lines.text: There's a natural explanation for everything.
[Leif Olsson has fallen off the roof and is dangling forward and back in the cable he was trying to install]

[commenting on the TV]
Now it's good... now it's bad... now it's good... now it's bad...

[about a ghost she just saw]
It was like I could see through it... like a cheese with holes in it.

[annoyed]
Yesterday, it was an armor. Today, a cheese with holes. What's it gonna be tomorrow? A toothbrush that smokes the peace pipe or a baboon that does the tango?
This is just like that Roxette video!
Yadda yadda, blah blah blah. I can't keep track of *all* details here. Just get it done!

[about Måns' scooter]
Have you ever gone faster than this?
Yeah, once. But the wind was in my back, and I had to take a leak.
[first lines]
Ghoooooooosts!
[Melitta reveals that Lillan knocked over an armor]
Oh, my God, that's horrible. Leif, does home insurance cover this?

[calmly]
We're not at home now.

[showing his palm, which is transparent]
Look, Lillan. Do you know what this is?
'Course I do. It's ectoplasm. It's ghost mucus.
The Count wanted the Princess to marry him, but she said that he wasn't her type, and disagreed.

[sarcastically]
The Interest Club takes a note.

[carrying the parabole on his head]
I'll be on the roof, kids. You keep things under control down here, right?

[saluting]
Yes, Mr. Chantarelle!
But what if the Count makes a ghost out of you too, like he did with Jean and Staffan?
It's a risk I have to take.

[after kissing Måns]
Ew! You're tongue is all gluey!

[lisping]
Uh, yeah, that'th what happenth when you lick two thouthand thtampth.

[about Dioda]
How come she can't talk?
Well, she's been locked away for a long time, maybe she just forgot how to speak.
Yeah, I forget my English vocabulary in a week!

[thinking]
I have to talk to her. But what am I going to say? "Hi, handsome, you wanna hang out and play video games." No, not that! "What's a princess like you doing in a castle like this?" No, that's not good either! I know! "Do you want to come with me and read The Phantom?" No, no, no! Why does she have to be able to read my mind? Hey, wait! If I wear the saucepan over my head, she can't hear my thoughts! That's good.
[puts saucepan on his head]
[Princess Dioda walks in]
Hi, Ivar. Why do you have that saucepan on your head?
[removes the saucepan and thinks to Dioda]
What? ..."The Phantom", what's that?
Noo! That wasn't what I was supposed to think!
What?
I was thinking I was going to think what I didn't think. So the thought that I thought was not the thought I was thinking about!
Ivar... I have ears, too.

[thinking]
She's so good-looking!
You look pretty good, too, Ivar.

[thinking]
Huh! She can read my mind! This is so embarrassing!
I'm sorry about this, you've all been very nice to me. But I have to go home now. To the Milky Way.

[solemnly]
Yeah. What a pity we won't get to see any more of you.

[to Ralf]
Hey... you're friend's been to the bathroom for pretty long now, maybe we should go check on him?
Oh, God, please don't tell me the bathroom door's lock is jammed again! Leif, go check on it!
No! No. I mean, he's got a very big bladder. You never know how long he'll be in there. Sometimes he has to stand there for days and nights!
Hey, you just said his bladder was really small. Now you're saying it's big. Make up your mind!

Uh... yeah! You know, that's the thing with his bladder. Sometimes it's really really big, and then - suddenly! - it's small. Yeah, his bladder is a complete mystery, you never know where you have it.
